meanings.definition: A type of work song traditionally sung by sailors.
meanings.sent1: The sailors sang shanteys to keep their spirits high during long voyages.
meanings.sent2: The crew sang shanteys together while hoisting the sails.
meanings.sent3: The shanteys echoed across the deck, lifting the sailors' moods.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic shanteys filled the air, guiding the sailors through their tasks.
meanings.sent5: The haunting melody of the shanteys stayed with the sailors long after the voyage ended.

meanings.definition: A type of folk music characterized by call-and-response singing.
meanings.sent1: The community gathered to enjoy the lively shanteys performed by the local musicians.
meanings.sent2: The festival featured a variety of shanteys that had the audience clapping along.
meanings.sent3: The catchy shanteys had everyone joining in the chorus with joy.
meanings.sent4: The rhythmic beats of the shanteys resonated through the town, bringing people together.
meanings.sent5: The traditional shanteys told stories of the sea in a captivating way.

meanings.definition: A type of song used to coordinate physical labor.
meanings.sent1: The workers sang shanteys to synchronize their movements while loading the cargo.
meanings.sent2: The rhythmic shanteys helped the team stay in rhythm while working together.
meanings.sent3: The humorous shanteys lightened the mood and made the work more enjoyable.
meanings.sent4: The powerful shanteys motivated the workers to push through the challenging tasks.
meanings.sent5: The energetic shanteys kept the workers moving in perfect harmony.
